definitions.definition: A competitive sporting event such as a boxing meet, a baseball game, or a cricket match.
definitions.example: My local team are playing in a match against their arch-rivals today.

definitions.definition: Any contest or trial of strength or skill, or to determine superiority.
Someone with a measure of an attribute equaling or exceeding the object of comparison.
definitions.example: He knew he had met his match.

definitions.definition: A candidate for matrimony; one to be gained in marriage.
Equality of conditions in contest or competition.
A pair of items or entities with mutually suitable characteristics.
definitions.example: The carpet and curtains are a match.

definitions.definition: A perforated board, block of plaster, hardened sand, etc., in which a pattern is partly embedded when a mould is made, for giving shape to the surfaces of separation between the parts of the mould.
To agree; to be equal; to correspond.
definitions.example: Their interests didn't match, so it took a long time to agree what to do together.

definitions.definition: To agree with; to be equal to; to correspond to.
definitions.example: His interests didn't match her interests.

definitions.definition: To make a successful match or pairing.
definitions.example: They found out about his color-blindness when he couldn't match socks properly.

definitions.definition: To equal or exceed in achievement.
definitions.example: She matched him at every turn: anything he could do, she could do as well or better.

definitions.definition: To unite in marriage, to mate.
To fit together, or make suitable for fitting together; specifically, to furnish with a tongue and groove at the edges.
A device made of wood or paper, at the tip coated with chemicals that ignite with the friction of being dragged (struck) against a rough dry surface.
definitions.example: He struck a match and lit his cigarette.
